content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal experience or cultural knowledge, including Stavropol. However, traditional food and drinks served during religious festivals in Stavropol may include:

1. Kulich - a traditional Russian Easter cake
2. Paskha - a sweet cottage cheese dessert eaten during Easter
3. Blini - thin, crepe-like pancakes served with caviar, sour cream, or jam
4. Kvas - a fermented drink made from bread or grain
5. Medovukha - a traditional Russian honey-based alcoholic drink
6. Vareniki - a type of dumpling filled with potato, cheese, or meat
7. Shashlik - marinated grilled meat, usually made from lamb, beef, or pork

These traditional dishes and drinks are an essential part of the festivals in Stavropol, and locals often enjoy them with their families and friends during the festivities.
